author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
The Maharashtra police foiled the plan of the Ranragini Bhumata Brigade to enter the inner sanctum of the Trimbakeshwar temple in Nashik on the occasion of Mahashivratri on Monday.

Last week, Trupti Desai, who is heading the organisation, declared that she, along with 200 women, would attempt to breach the inner sanctum, out of bounds for women, of the temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.

In a replay of the organisation’s much-publicised campaign to enter the inner sanctum of the Shani Shingnapur temple in Ahmednagar district in January, the police deployed in large numbers stopped Ms. Desai and others at Nandur, 81 km from Pune.

“We condemn the police action. We’ve been detained for no reason, we were heading to the Trimbakeshwar temple peacefully...,” Ms. Desai said after her arrest. She urged Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to intervene and allow women to offer worship in the inner sanctum.

“We have detained around 100 women activists,” a senior police officer said.
title: Police foil women’s bid to enter sanctum of Shiva temple
